questions.question_text: An instructor was unable to cover the last concept in the course, yet test results from the last day indicated that all members of the class correctly answered questions addressing this concept. In this situation, which of the following should the instructor have done?

choices.C: Evaluated learner's attainment of end-of-course objectives
choices.D: Judged the adequacy of the evaluation

discussion.content:
C. 
In the situation where an instructor was unable to cover the last concept in the course, yet test results from the last day indicated that all members of the class correctly answered questions addressing this concept, the instructor should have evaluated the learners' attainment of end-of-course objectives. Option C is the correct choice in this scenario.

End-of-course objectives provide a framework for measuring whether learners have achieved the intended learning outcomes of the course. By evaluating the learners' attainment of end-of-course objectives, the instructor can determine whether the course was successful in meeting its goals, despite not covering the last concept.

Monitoring learner performance during instruction in option A and administering tests in option B are important instructional practices, but they do not address the issue of evaluating whether the course was successful in meeting its goals. Judging the adequacy of the evaluation in option D is not applicable, as the evaluation results indicate that the learners achieved the intended learning outcomes, regardless of whether the last concept was covered or not.

questions.question_text: After presenting a new topic, the instructor initiates a class discussion based on the presentation. The discussion is designed to enhance learner understanding and stimulate interest in the topic. Which of the following BEST describes the skill demonstrated by the instructor1?

choices.B: The instructor used a variety of question types and techniques
choices.D: The instructor used active listening techniques to facilitate learning
choices.A: The instructor selected and implemented appropriate delivery methods
choices.C: The instructor used appropriate instructional media

choices.A: Attempt to save the situation by telling another joke
choices.C: Retell the joke explaining its punch line
choices.D: Decide not to use humor in future presentations
choices.B: Pretend nothing happened and continue with the lesson

discussion.content: C. Retell the joke explaining its punch line.

questions.question_text: To illustrate a point, the trainer uses a joke that the class does not understand. Which of the following should the trainer do next?
An instructor has a class of learners who are required to attend. Most of the learners are not paying attention or participating. Which of the following will increase the level of learner motivation?

choices.B: Ask the learners if there is something more relevant they would prefer to learn.
choices.D: Explain to the learners that they are only in class for a few days, and to make the best of it.
choices.A: Explain to the learners that the material is really interesting and they might want to pay attention.
choices.C: Explain to the learners the skills they learn by taking this class could lead to career benefits.

discussion.content: C. Explain to the learners the skills they learn by taking this class could lead to career benefits.

GOAL: To employ instructional techniques appropriate to methods and instructional situations prescribed
ACTION: At the completion of each of the courseware's modules, the instructor lists additional reference materials and suggests additional exercises for the students.
